newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Senate panel approves re-election bill.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Senate panel approves re-election bill.

text.p: A commission in Brazil's Senate approved a bill which would allow President Fernando Henrique Cardoso to run for a second term next year, an official said.
The upper house's Constitution and Justice Committee approved the constitutional amendment with 19 members voting in favor and three against, the official said.
The panel was due to continue voting on a series of amendments to the bill.
The amendment would then advance to the floor of the Senate where it requires two three-fifths majorities. It has already been approved in the Chamber of Deputies.
